data.question: What is the chemical formula for the first dinuclear Dysprosium(III) Single-Molecule Magnet mentioned?
What solvent mixture was used to obtain [Dy2(hmi)2(NO3)2(MeOH)2]1·MeCN (2·MeCN)?
data.answer: A 3:1 mixture of acetonitrile and methanol

data.question: What is the space group of the complex [Dy2(hmi)2(NO3)2(MeOH)2] (1)?
What property of dysprosium-based materials has increased interest in the area of molecular magnetism?
What is the role of the H2hmi ligand in the synthesis of dinuclear dysprosium(III) SMMs?
data.answer: It acts as a rigid chelate providing O,N,O,O-based multichelating sites favorable for lanthanide ion complex formation.

data.question: What is the expected value of cT for two dysprosium(III) ions at room temperature?
Why are pure lanthanide SMMs relatively scarce?
data.answer: Due to the difficulty in promoting magnetic interactions in these systems.

data.question: How does the ligand design contribute to the synthesis of high-energy-barrier SMMs?
data.answer: By promoting ferromagnetic interaction between the dysprosium(III) ions and organizing the SMMs into networks.

data.question: What indicates the slow relaxation of magnetization in dysprosium(III) cores?
What happens to the cT product at low temperatures for complexes 1 and 2?
data.answer: It increases sharply to a maximum value, suggesting the presence of intramolecular ferromagnetic interactions.

data.question: What does the absence of the M vs. H hysteresis loop above 1.8 K indicate?
data.answer: The presence of a relatively fast zero-field relaxation.

data.question: What effect does an applied dc field have on the relaxation time of complexes 1 and 2?
data.answer: It significantly increases the relaxation time under certain conditions.

data.question: Is the H2hmi ligand used in the synthesis of dinuclear dysprosium(III) SMMs a linear ligand?
Do complexes 1 and 2 have the same space group?
Is the magnetic anisotropy of dysprosium-based materials considered small?
Are the magnetic properties of 1 and 2 expected to be different due to their structural differences?
Does the presence of intramolecular ferromagnetic interactions decrease at low temperatures?
Is the relaxation time for both compounds under a dc field unrelated to the zero-field measurements?
Does the application of a dc field always minimize quantum relaxation effects?
Is complex 2 reported to have the largest energy barrier among lanthanide complexes?
